org.corfudb.runtime.stream

Class NewStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.corfudb.runtime.stream.NewStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, IStream

    public class NewStream
extends Object
implements IStream
    This is the new stream implementation. It relies on several components: A stream address space (where the address space keeps track of streams) * Consequently, this requires new logging units which track streams. A new streaming sequencer, with backpointer support. Created by mwei on 8/28/15.

    • Method Detail

      • append

        public ITimestamp append(Object data)
                  throws IOException
        Append an object to the stream. This operation may or may not be successful. For example, a move operation may occur, and the append will not be part of the stream.
        Specified by:
        append in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        data - A serializable object to append to the stream.
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the physical position and the epoch the data was written in.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • reserve

        public ITimestamp[] reserve(int numTokens)
                     throws IOException
        Reserves a given number of timestamps in this stream. This operation may or may not retrieve valid timestamps. For example, a move operation may occur and these timestamps will not be valid on the stream.
        Specified by:
        reserve in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        numTokens - The number of tokens to allocate.
        Returns:
        A set of timestamps representing the tokens to allocate.
        Throws:
        IOException

        public CompletableFuture<ITimestamp[]> reserveAsync(int numTokens)
        Reserves a given number of timestamps in this stream. This operation may or may not retrieve valid timestamps. For example, a move operation may occur and these timestamps will not be valid on the stream.
        Specified by:
        reserveAsync in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        numTokens - The number of tokens to allocate.
        Returns:
        A set of timestamps representing the tokens to allocate.

      • write

        public void write(ITimestamp timestamp,
                  Object data)
           throws OutOfSpaceException,
                  OverwriteException,
                  IOException
        Write to a specific, previously allocated log position.
        Specified by:
        write in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The timestamp to write to.
        data - The data to write to that timestamp.
        Throws:
        OutOfSpaceException - If there is no space left to write to that log position.
        OverwriteException - If something was written to that log position already.
        IOException

        public IStreamEntry readNextEntry()
                           throws HoleEncounteredException,
                                  TrimmedException,
                                  IOException
        Read the next entry in the stream as a IStreamEntry. This function retrieves the next entry in the stream, or null, if there are no more entries in the stream.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        A CorfuDBStreamEntry containing the payload of the next entry in the stream.

        TrimmedException

        Given a timestamp, get the timestamp in the stream
        Specified by:
        getNextTimestamp in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        ts - The timestamp to increment.
        Returns:

        Parameters:

      • fillHole

        public boolean fillHole(ITimestamp ts)
        Attempts to fill a hole at the given timestamp.
        Specified by:
        fillHole in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        ts - A timestamp to fill a hole at.
        Returns:
        True, if the hole was successfully filled, false otherwise.

      • check

        public ITimestamp check(boolean cached)
        Returns a fresh or cached timestamp, which can serve as a linearization point. This function may return a non-linearizable (invalid) timestamp which may never occur in the ordering due to a move/epoch change.
        Specified by:
        check in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        cached - Whether or not the timestamp returned is cached.
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the most recently allocated timestamp in the stream, or currently read, depending on whether cached is set or not.

      • checkAsync

        public CompletableFuture<ITimestamp> checkAsync()
        Asynchronously returns a new timestamp, which can serve as a linearization point.
        Specified by:
        checkAsync in interface IStream
        Returns:
        A completable future, which will return a timestamp when completed.

      • getCurrentPosition

        public ITimestamp getCurrentPosition()
        Gets the current position the stream has read to (which may not point to an entry in the stream).
        Specified by:
        getCurrentPosition in interface IStream
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the most recently read address in the stream.

      • trim

        public void trim(ITimestamp address)
        Requests a trim on this stream. This function informs the configuration master that the position on this stream is trimmable, and moves the start position of this stream to the new position.
        Specified by:
        trim in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        address -
